subject: RE: New feature for our 'Project Pages' - Research timeline
preview: @heath All good now on this one. Cheers!

full_threads.body: @heath All good now on this one. Cheers!

Hi Heath,



I got the one below on the 22nd but I sent this response back on the 23rd (attached)…J



Thanks



Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

We did it back on Jan 22... Did you get my email? Here is the link to review: https://msra.org.au/project/genetic-changes-progressive-ms/

Hi Heath,



Just checking in to see if this can be updated as I'm keen to put the timelines up on all the relevant project pages.



Thanks



Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

That is the latest version of copy we have.... We noticed that 'Basic Laboratory research' title need to updated to 'Fundamental laboratory research' and have done so. Please let know specifically what other copy is incorrect?

Looks good Heath!



The only thing is the copy in the images seems to have reverted back to an older version of the copy (prior to the latest iteration)….

Hi Lizzy, 

Ok it's now ready for you to check out: https://msra.org.au/project/genetic-changes-progressive-ms/

Let us know what you think?

Great - thank you so much!



Lizzy

Ok Lizzy,

Sure, we should be able to get it done this afternoon. I'll keep you in the loop.

Hi Heath,


This looks amazing! So much more what we had in mind - thank you J


I just have a few more bits of minor feedback as follows but then we should be good to go.


I wondered if there was any chance that the amends could be made this afternoon and be ready for practical application tonight or if it needs more work from a build point of view?


The reason being this feature will look really great on the 21 project pages we are publishing tonight and if at all possible we'd love to have this on those pages.


Summary of amends (I've marked up the attached image too, to hopefully make it as easy as possible to interpret):


· Title updating to 'Stages of the research process'

· More visually overtly obvious which stage the current project is at (maybe orange outline all the way around whichever the 'current' phase is)

· Replace 'phases 1, 2, 3' with this copy that I think has dropped off the radar from the first iteration:
'Lab to clinic timeline: 10+ years' 'Lab to clinic timeline: 5+ years' 'Lab to clinic timeline: 1-5 years'

· Icon for the 'Clinical studies and clinical trials' to be changed from a trophy to something like this…(with little people icons in it and a test tube or clipboard)


Appreciate all your help with this.


Thanks


Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

We have created a revised design. I steered more towards using icons and kept a linear composition to fit nicely into the space and work well on mobile as well. I also kept to shades of the brand colours (blues and oranges) to keep it consistent with the site. 

On mobile views we will 'stack them' if that makes sense. Let me know your thoughts?

@heath I have added some changes on the metabox for this one. If they didn't select a timeline in this 3 (Basic, Translation, Clinical) the timeline wont show and I have updated the some text changes as well. Also regarding the design, let me know if you need to talk me through it. Thanks!

Hi Heath,



Great - thank you.



Is it also possible to have an option in the back-end to have no timeline visible?



The reason I ask is that we have about 21 project pages which are going live on Wednesday morning (23rd) - ideally I want to have the timeline on them but if we haven't finalised the visual element of the timeline by tomorrow afternoon, I don't want it to be visible on the pages until it's been signed off.



Appreciate your guidance.



Thanks



Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Ok sure, we will work on this early next week. It will help having the revised copy.

Hi Heath,


Thanks so much for sending this through and apologies for the delay in coming back to you.


I've chatted a couple of colleagues through the idea and there are a couple of bits of feedback which I've summarised below.


· Couple of updates to the copy:

- Update graphic title from 'Research Timeline' to 'Stages of the research process'




- Instead of using the word 'impact' use the words 'Lab to clinic timeline' (e.g. Lab to clinic timeline: 10+ years)




- Basic Laboratory research title updated to 'Fundamental laboratory research' and explanation updated to: Laboratory research that investigates scientific theories behind the possible causes, disease progression, ways to diagnose and better treat MS.


- Translational research explanation updated to: Research that builds on fundamental scientific research to develop new therapies, medical procedures or diagnostics and advances it closer to the clinic.


- Clinical Studies and Clinical Trials explanation updated to: Clinical research is the culmination of fundamental and translational research turning those research discoveries into treatments and interventions for people with MS.




· Design needs to be more visually appealing and less box-like (e.g. include the use of icons as the visual rather than boxes, in a similar way to the graphic below). Perhaps using the brighter, more stylised colourful 'phases' image below.

Basically just being a bit more creative with the design and making it more visually appealing by incorporating icons and all the copy onto the graphic (so removing the 'Find out more' section as we've tried hard to trim down the explanation copy, and incorporating that copy into the image itself, kind of like the 'phases' image below).


Possible icons for this particular graphic could be:

Fundamental lab research = a microscope icon

Translational research = a magnifying glass icon

Clinical studies = people icon




Let me know if you have any questions or if anything needs further explanation.


Thanks so much


Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Hope you are well. We have coded an example of this for you: https://msra.org.au/project/genetic-changes-progressive-ms/

The 'active' stage is highlighted in orange so the view knows what the current stage is. Note, we are still working on the mobile views, but I wanted to keep you in the loop. 

Please have a look and let me know your thoughts?

Hi,



If you could prioritise this one over the new researcher sections that would be great.



Thanks



Lizzy
@joel, this is a quick task but I will need to brief you on it when we get back. Cheers

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Lizzy,

Ok sure, no problems and thanks for the final copy. Can you please let me know out of this and the new researcher sections/bios which one you want us to prioritise? That way we can tackle the most important one first.

Hi Heath,



Happy New Year! I hope you had a lovely break.



Sorry I didn't manage to get this across to you before I went on leave. Here is the final copy:





Also, is it possible to have the explanation copy hidden unless the user hovers over the title? So for example, just the titles of the three stages would be visible unless the user hovered on the title and then the full explanation would either drop down or appear in some way.



If you could let me know when you think you may be able to send a draft of this back that would be amazing.



Thanks



Lizzy
